lexUnit.name: revolting.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: brings about feelings of disgust

sentence.text: There are memories you never forget -- and they are revolting memories -- and here they come again .
My little brother is quite revolting .
And I tell you here and now , I find this whole idea utterly revolting . "
The blame should lie with those revolting perverts who brought her so low . "
They have spent all their money on gewgaws and revolting tinned restaurant meals .
` Driving through a locust swarm is a revolting experience " he wrote .
He thought she had a growth , or was losing her innards in some revolting way .
for harmony within the family -- a disobedient child or revolting adolescent sets the scene for an unhappy home and disharmony between the parents ;
Of course we were fascinated by revolting food , and liked inventing horror meals .
Some of the atrocities were unbelievably revolting .
The annoying thing was that the revolting youth had put his finger on a significant point .
It is only when the parents begin telling us about the brilliance of their own revolting offspring , that we start shouting , ` Bring us a basin !
So the charts are riddled with appalling rehashes and reissues and revolting rhymes with neither reason nor sense .
The traditional method of slaughter by slow strangulation might well seem revolting but that is admitted to be a ` waning practice " .
She stood up and poured the rest of the highball over his head -- the bed was now covered in a revolting mixture of olive oil and melting ice -- then she nipped out to the icebox .
The sink , which held a further supply of greasy dishes , was covered in a revolting green scum .
Leith snapped , feeling sick inside as a revolting memory of Alec Ardis hit her .
It is an absolutely revolting offence against someone suffering from Downs Syndrome . "
